t: Proverbs 29
He,*p that being often reproved hardeneth his neck, shall suddenly be destroyed, and that without remedy.
When*p the righteous are in authority, the people rejoice: but when the wicked beareth rule, the people mourn.
Whoso*p loveth wisdom rejoiceth his father: but he that keepeth company with harlots spendeth his substance.
The*p king by judgment establisheth the land: but he that receiveth gifts overthroweth it.
A*p man that flattereth his neighbour spreadeth a net for his feet.
In*p the transgression of an evil man there is a snare: but the righteous doth sing and rejoice.
The*p righteous considereth the cause of the poor: but the wicked regardeth not to know it.
Scornful*p men bring a city into a snare: but wise men turn away wrath.
If*p a wise man contendeth with a foolish man, whether he rage or laugh, there is no rest.
The*p bloodthirsty hate the upright: but the just seek his soul.
A*p fool uttereth all his mind: but a wise man keepeth it in till afterwards.
If*p a ruler hearken to lies, all his servants are wicked.
The*p poor and the deceitful man meet together: the Lord*s lighteneth both their eyes.
The*p king that faithfully judgeth the poor, his throne shall be established for ever.
The*p rod and reproof give wisdom: but a child left to himself bringeth his mother to shame.
When*p the wicked are multiplied, transgression increaseth: but the righteous shall see their fall.
Correct*p thy son, and he shall give thee rest; yea, he shall give delight unto thy soul.
Where*p there is no vision, the people perish: but he that keepeth the law, happy is he.
A*p servant will not be corrected by words: for though he understand he will not answer.
Seest*p thou a man that is hasty in his words? there is more hope of a fool than of him.
He*p that delicately bringeth up his servant from a child shall have him become his son at the length.
An*p angry man stirreth up strife, and a furious man aboundeth in transgression.
A*p man's pride shall bring him low: but honour shall uphold the humble in spirit.
Whoso*p is partner with a thief hateth his own soul: he heareth cursing, and bewrayeth it not.
The*p fear of man bringeth a snare: but whoso putteth his trust in the Lord*s shall be safe.
Many*p seek the ruler's favour; but every man's judgment cometh from the Lord.*s
An*p unjust man is an abomination to the just: and he that is upright in the way is abomination to the wicked.
